unnormalised: **Energy & Utilities: Solar Rooftop Subsidies Boost Adoption in Maharashtra**
normalised: energy and utilities: solar rooftop subsidies boost adoption in Maharashtra

unnormalised: Mumbai, Maharashtra – The Maharashtra Energy Development Agency (MEDA) announced increased subsidies for residential solar rooftop installations, effective immediately. Under the revised scheme, individual households can avail up to Rs. 75,000 in subsidies for systems ranging from 3 kW to 10 kW capacity.
normalised: Mumbai, Maharashtra – The M E D A announced increased subsidies for residential solar rooftop installations, effective immediately. Under the revised scheme, individual households can avail up to rupees seventy five thousand in subsidies for systems ranging from three kilowatt to ten kilowatt capacity.

unnormalised: Dr. Anil Sharma, Director of MEDA, stated that the move aims to accelerate the adoption of renewable energy and reduce the burden on the state's power grid, especially during peak summer months. The subsidy is applicable to installations utilizing Made-in-India solar panels, promoting local manufacturing.
normalised: Doctor Anil Sharma, Director of M E D A, stated that the move aims to accelerate the adoption of renewable energy and reduce the burden on the state's power grid, especially during peak summer months. The subsidy is applicable to installations utilizing Made-in-India solar panels, promoting local manufacturing.

unnormalised: "We hope to see more families like the Sharmas in Pune benefit from this initiative and embrace solar power," Dr. Sharma added, referencing early adopters. The subsidy applies to systems covering up to 500 sq ft of rooftop area. Applicants must register through the MEDA portal and adhere to BIS standards for installation. Experts predict this will reduce electricity bills for households by up to 40%. This initiative is part of the larger 'Surya Maharashtra' campaign aimed at generating 10,000 MW of solar power by 2027.
